pages.title: Strip Mine Tool
pages.text: The strip mine tool digs a 1×2 tunnel at the optimal Y-level for your target ore.$(br2)$(bold)How it works:$(br)$(li)Descends to the best Y-level for the target ore$(li)Tunnels horizontally in the specified direction$(li)Scans walls, ceiling, and floor for ores$(li)Side-trips to mine any ores found within 2 blocks$(li)Stops when target count is reached or tunnel length limit$(br2)Example: $(thing)"Strip mine for iron, 48 blocks east"$() → descends to Y=16 and tunnels 48 blocks east.

pages.title: Parameters
pages.text: $(bold)ore$() — Target ore type (iron, diamond, gold, etc.)$(br)$(bold)length$() — Tunnel length, 4-64 blocks (default: 32)$(br)$(bold)count$() — Stop after N ores found (0 = tunnel full length)$(br)$(bold)direction$() — north/south/east/west (default: facing direction)$(br)$(bold)plan$() — What to do after mining (e.g. "smelt the iron then craft an iron pickaxe")$(br2)The companion auto-crafts a correct-tier pickaxe before mining if needed.
